sen.j: 勧修寺 徳子（かしゅうじ なりこ、天明8年11月3日 (旧暦)（1788年11月30日） - 明治11年（1878年）11月23日）は、江戸時代後期－明治初期にかけての女官。
sen.e: Nariko KASHUJI (November 30, 1788 - November 23, 1878) was a court lady from the late Edo period to the early Meiji period.
Nariko KASHUJI (November 30, 1788 - November 23, 1878) was a court lady from the late Edo period to the early Meiji period.
Nariko KASHUJI (November 30, 1788 - November 23, 1878) was a court lady from the late Edo period to the early Meiji period.
She was "naishi no kami" (Principal Handmaid) to Emperor Ninko.
She was Naishi no Kami (Principal Handmaid) of Emperor Ninko.
sen.cmt: ダブルクオテーションを取りました。
sen.e: She was Naishi no Kami (Principal Handmaid) of Emperor Ninko.
Her childhood names were Nao and Mina.
Her childhood names were Nao and Mina.
Her childhood names were Nao and Mina.

sen.j: 号は、細井、権典侍、督典侍、新中納言典侍、新大典侍、藤大納言、京極。
sen.e: Her titles included "Hosoi," "Gon no naishi no suke," "Ko no suke," "Shin chunagon no suke," "Shin-taisuke," "To-dainagon," and "Kyogoku."
sen.cmt: 権典侍、督典侍、新中納言典侍などは、「親の官職＋自分の身分」を表わすようです。さらに典侍は叙任された位階で明示した方がわかりやすいと思いますが、グーグル検索の範囲を超えてしまいます。ここでは単に号を列挙しているだけなので、説明はあえて省略します。
sen.e: Her titles included Hosoi, Gon no Naishi no Suke, Ko no suke, Shin Chunagon no Suke, Shin-daitenji, To-dainagon, and Kyogoku.
sen.cmt: ダブルクオテーションを取りました。
sen.e: Her titles included Hosoi, Gon no Naishi no Suke, Ko no suke, Shin Chunagon no Suke, Shin-daitenji, To-dainagon, and Kyogoku.

sen.j: 権大納言勧修寺経逸の娘。
sen.e: She was the daughter of Tsunehaya KASHUJI who was Gon-dainagon (Deputy Major Councillor).
She was a daughter of Tsunehaya KASHUJI, Gon Dainagon (Provisional Chief Councilor of State).
sen.cmt: 官位の表記を用語統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: She was a daughter of Tsunehaya KASHUJI, Gon Dainagon (Provisional Chief Councilor of State).

sen.j: 仁孝天皇生母・勧修寺ただ子（東京極院）は姉にあたる。
sen.e: Tadako KASHUJI (Higashi-kyogokuin), the biological mother of Emperor Ninko, was her elder sister.
Tadako KASHUJI (Higashikyogokuin), the biological mother of Emperor Ninko, was her older sister.
sen.cmt: 東京極院をの表記をWebの用語集に合わせました。
sen.e: Tadako KASHUJI (Higashikyogokuin), the biological mother of Emperor Ninko, was her older sister.

sen.j: 寛政12年（1800年）、姉の婧子が儲君（のちの仁孝天皇）を生んだことから上臈代として召されて宮中に入る。
sen.e: In 1800 she entered the court as "joro-dai" since her elder sister Tadako gave birth to an imperial prince (who later became Emperor Ninko).
In 1800 she entered the court as Joro-dai (deputy post of high-ranking lady-in-waiting) since her older sister Tadako gave a birth to the crown prince (later Emperor Ninko).
sen.cmt: 上臈代は、上臈の代理の役職と解釈し、英文に追記しました。儲君は皇太子の意味のため、英文に反映しました。
sen.e: In 1800 she entered the court as Joro-dai (deputy post of high-ranking lady-in-waiting) since her older sister Tadako gave a birth to the crown prince (later Emperor Ninko).

sen.j: 文化 (元号)6年（1809年）儲君付上臈となり、「細井」と号する。
sen.e: In 1809 she became Joro (Lady in Waiting) to the imperial prince and called herself 'Hosoi.'
In 1809 she became Joro (high-ranking lady-in-waiting) of the crown prince and called herself 'Hosoi.'
sen.cmt: 上臈代の補足説明と合わせました。
sen.e: In 1809 she became Joro (high-ranking lady-in-waiting) of the crown prince and called herself 'Hosoi.'

sen.j: 文化14年（1817年）に仁孝天皇の践祚とともに権典侍となった。
sen.e: In 1817 she became "Gon no naishi no suke" when the imperial prince acceded to the throne to become Emperor Ninko.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1817 she became Gon no Naishi no Suke (provisional maid of honor) when the crown prince acceded to the throne and became Emperor Ninko.
sen.cmt: 権典侍の補足説明をWebの用語集を参考に追記しましたが、「権」はの訳は、権大納言等に合わせました。
sen.e: In 1817 she became Gon no Naishi no Suke (provisional maid of honor) when the crown prince acceded to the throne and became Emperor Ninko.

sen.j: 仁孝・孝明天皇両天皇の信任厚く、両天皇の皇子・皇女の養育にあたった。
sen.e: Deeply trusted by Emperors Ninko and Komei, she was in charge of educating their princes and princesses.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Deeply trusted by Emperor Ninko and Emperor Komei, she was in charge of educating their princes and princesses.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Deeply trusted by Emperor Ninko and Emperor Komei, she was in charge of educating their princes and princesses.

sen.j: （ただし、成長したのは和宮親子内親王のみ）。
sen.e: (It was only Imperial Princess Kazunomiya Chikako who grew to maturity).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (It was only Imperial Princess Kazunomiya Chikako who grew up).
(It was only Imperial Princess Kazunomiya Chikako who grew up).

sen.j: 安政4年（1857年）に新大典侍に進み、次いで文久2年（1862年）に隠居をした際には従三位及び藤大納言の称号が与えられた。
sen.e: In 1857 she advanced to the rank of "Shin-taisuke," and when she retired in 1862 she was granted the Junior Third Rank as well as the title of To-dainagon.
In 1857 she was promoted to the rank of Shin-daitenji, and when she retired in 1862, she was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and the title of To-dainagon.
In 1857 she was promoted to the rank of Shin-daitenji, and when she retired in 1862, she was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and the title of To-dainagon.

sen.j: 和宮降嫁問題が起きると、孝明天皇の意向を受けて、和宮の説得にあたり、御世話掛として江戸城に入った。
sen.e: When Imperial Princess Kazunomiya's marrying down to a shogun was discussed, she was asked by Emperor Komei to persuade the princess and entered the Edo castle to take care of her.
When the problem of Imperial Princess Kazunomiya's Koka (marrying down to a shogun) was raised, Emperor Komei asked Nariko to persuade the princess and to enter the Edo castle to look her after.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: When the problem of Imperial Princess Kazunomiya's Koka (marrying down to a shogun) was raised, Emperor Komei asked Nariko to persuade the princess and to enter the Edo castle to look her after.

sen.j: 後に京都に戻り、慶応4年（1868年）7月に宮中を退いた。
sen.e: Later she returned to Kyoto and left the court between August and September 1868.
Later she returned to Kyoto and left the court around August and September 1868.
Later she returned to Kyoto and left the court around August and September 1868.

sen.j: 明治10年（1877年）、長年の功績によって正三位に叙された。
sen.e: In 1877 she was granted the Senior Third Rank for her long-term services.
In 1877 she was conferred Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) for her long-term services.
sen.cmt: 官位の表記を用語統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: In 1877 she was conferred Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) for her long-term services.
She died at the age of 91.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She died at the age of 91.
She died at the age of 91.

sen.j: 墓は京都市中京区誓願寺にある。
sen.e: She was buried in Seigan-ji Temple in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She was buried in Seigan-ji Temple in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City.
